MtkRegionToPathList.c

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /*===========================================================================
00002 =                                                                           =
00003 =                           MtkRegionToPathList                             =
00004 =                                                                           =
00005 =============================================================================
00006 
00007                          Jet Propulsion Laboratory
00008                                    MISR
00009                                MISR Toolkit
00010 
00011             Copyright 2005, California Institute of Technology.
00012                            ALL RIGHTS RESERVED.
00013                  U.S. Government Sponsorship acknowledged.
00014 
00015 ============================================================================*/
00016 
00017 #include "MisrOrbitPath.h"
00018 #include "MisrCoordQuery.h"
00019 #include "MisrError.h"
00020 #include "MisrProjParam.h"
00021 #include <stdlib.h>
00022 
00038 MTKt_status MtkRegionToPathList(
00039   MTKt_Region region,   
00040   int *pathcnt,         
00041   int **pathlist         )
00042 {
00043   MTKt_status status_code;      /* Return code of this function */
00044   MTKt_status status;           /* Return status */
00045   int b;            /* Block */
00046   float l;          /* Line */
00047   float s;          /* Sample */
00048   int path;         /* Loop index */
00049   int pathlist_tmp[NPATH];  /* Temp pathlist */
00050   int *list = NULL;     /* Temp list */
00051   int cnt = 0;          /* Path count */
00052   int i;            /* Corner index */
00053   float lines[4];       /* Block corner lines */
00054   float samples[4];     /* Block corner samples */
00055   MTKt_boolean found = MTK_FALSE; /* Found a corner in the region flag */
00056   double lat_hextent_deg; /* Lat extent in degrees */
00057   double lon_hextent_deg; /* Lon exten in degrees */
00058   double ulclat; /* Lat of ULC of Region */
00059   double ulclon; /* Lon of ULC of Region */
00060   double lrclat; /* Lat of LRC of Region */
00061   double lrclon; /* Lon of LRC of Region */
00062   double blocklat = 0.0; /* Lat of block */
00063   double blocklon = 0.0; /* Lon of block */
00064   double deg_per_meter = 360.0 / 40007821.0; /* Average earth circumference (40075004m + 39940638m) / 2.0 = 40007821m */
00065 
00066   if (pathcnt == NULL || pathlist == NULL)
00067     MTK_ERR_CODE_JUMP(MTK_NULLPTR);
00068 
00069   /* -------------------------------------------- */
00070   /* Set lines and samples for four block corners */
00071   /* -------------------------------------------- */
00072 
00073   lines[0] = 0.0;
00074   samples[0] = 0.0;
00075   lines[1] = 0.0;
00076   samples[1] = MAXNSAMPLE - 1;
00077   lines[2] = MAXNLINE - 1 ;
00078   samples[2] = MAXNSAMPLE - 1;
00079   lines[3] = MAXNLINE - 1;
00080   samples[3] = 0.0;
00081 
00082   for (path = 1; path <= NPATH; path++) {
00083 
00084     /* ------------------------------------------------------------------- */
00085     /* If center of region is in a block then we have found a path - done. */
00086     /* ------------------------------------------------------------------- */
00087 
00088     status = MtkLatLonToBls(path, MAXRESOLUTION, region.geo.ctr.lat,
00089                             region.geo.ctr.lon, &b, &l, &s);
00090 
00091     if (status == MTK_SUCCESS) { /* --- Center coordinate is in a block in this path --- */
00092 
00093       found = MTK_TRUE;
00094 
00095     } else { /* --- Search block corners for a coordinate in this region --- */
00096       lat_hextent_deg = (region.hextent.xlat * deg_per_meter);
00097       lon_hextent_deg = (region.hextent.ylon * deg_per_meter);
00098       ulclat = region.geo.ctr.lat - lat_hextent_deg;
00099       ulclon = region.geo.ctr.lon - lon_hextent_deg;
00100       lrclat = region.geo.ctr.lat + lat_hextent_deg;
00101       lrclon = region.geo.ctr.lon + lon_hextent_deg;
00102 
00103       /* ------------------------------------------------------------------------ */
00104       /* Determine Lat/Lon coordinates of the corners of the region for this path */
00105       /* ------------------------------------------------------------------------ */
00106       status = MtkLatLonToBls(path, MAXRESOLUTION,
00107                               region.geo.ctr.lat - lat_hextent_deg,
00108                               region.geo.ctr.lon - lon_hextent_deg,
00109                               &b, &l, &s);
00110       
00111       /* --------------------------------------------------------------- */
00112       /* Loop over each block of the to find a corner inside the region  */
00113       /* --------------------------------------------------------------- */
00114 
00115       for (b = 1; b <= NBLOCK; b++) {
00116         for (i = 0; i < 4; i++) {          
00117           status = MtkBlsToLatLon(path, MAXRESOLUTION,b, lines[i], samples[i],
00118                                   &blocklat, &blocklon);
00119           if (blocklat >= ulclat && blocklat <= lrclat && blocklon >= ulclon && blocklon <= lrclon) {
00120             found = MTK_TRUE;
00121             // printf("Found block: %i in path: %i\n",b,path);
00122           }
00123         }
00124         if (found) break;
00125       }
00126     } /* --- End of block corner search --- */
00127 
00128     /* -------------------------------------------------- */
00129     /* Add path to pathlist only if it crosses the region */
00130     /* -------------------------------------------------- */
00131 
00132     if (found) {
00133       pathlist_tmp[cnt++] = path;
00134       found = MTK_FALSE;
00135     } // else { printf("No block found for path: %i\n", path); }
00136   } /* --- End of path loop --- */
00137 
00138   if (cnt == 0) MTK_ERR_CODE_JUMP(MTK_NOT_FOUND);
00139 
00140   list = (int *)malloc(cnt * sizeof(int));
00141   if (list == NULL) 
00142     MTK_ERR_CODE_JUMP(MTK_MALLOC_FAILED);
00143 
00144   for (path = 0; path < cnt; path++) {
00145     list[path] = pathlist_tmp[path];
00146   }
00147 
00148   *pathcnt = cnt;
00149   *pathlist = list;
00150 
00151   return MTK_SUCCESS;
00152  ERROR_HANDLE:
00153   return status_code;
00154 }
